name: Hipping Hall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hipping Hall doesnt feel like a hotel, more a country house owned by a friend who's invited you to stay and is determined to look after you. The food was awesome and by the time the petit fours arrived, we were glad we were staying the night.
reviews.title: Country house experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are all different, some with baths, ours (room 1) had a large walk-in shower. One quirk of a 15th century building is low doorways: remember to stoop when visiting the bathroom.
reviews.title: very impressive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only 2 very minor niggles:
reviews.title: Lived Up To Reputation

reviews.text: Bathroom had no shaver point (no problem for me as I wet-shave)
reviews.title: First class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast ends at 0930, would have liked to enjoy that wonderful bed a bit longer.
reviews.title: Exceptional, a real treat!

reviews.text: Myself and my husband stayed at Hipping Hall for our 2nd Wedding anniversary. What a treat!. We were in room 8 which is in the cottage. The room was very modern and the bathroom was great. The drench shower was fantastic. One small niggle, there was a room above ours in the cottage and unfortunatley you could hear EVERY noise and footstep from upstairs. I think this is mainly due to the age of the cottage however when you are away to relax it is a bit disappointing.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The meal was to die for. Everything we ate was fantastic. The extra touches that the chef went to was really appreciated. Little things like the box of chocolates with petite fours was great although i didnt have room to eat them.
reviews.title: Easily met our expectations...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a fantastic night away and we will certainly be going back for our 3rd Anniversary!!
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place
What an amazing experience!
reviews.text: I recently stayed at Hipping Hall for my 20th wedding anniversary. On the back of a number of favourable reviews on TA I decided to try Hipping ahead of other, more well known, hotels in the Lakes and was not disappointed. Having spent the day walking in the Coniston fells, on a typical 2008 summer's day when it rained for 8 hours solid and the only view from the top of the 'Old Man of Coniston' was clould, we arrived at Hipping Hall with high expectations and in need of some warmth.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 7, a quirky little room in the cottage, and were delighted to be greeted with the offer of a pot of hot coffee and biscuits in our room. The underfloor heating in the bathroom was also appreciated as was the sunken bath.
reviews.title: Foodie heaven.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just had an overnight stay at Hipping Hall 11th March as a birthday treat and what a treat it was! I had read the other reviews and i have to agree wholeheartedly with all the praise. It is a truely lovely place congratulations to Andrew who is very much a hands on host and also THANKYOU to all his staff .... The housekeeper who gave us a tour of the rooms (2 AND 6 being our choice next time .We went with our well travelled dog and could only stay in 7 in the cottage which was still fab)...
reviews.title: its all true !

reviews.text: To the very proffesional but friendly restaurant staff .... and to the chef and his team in the kitchen who produced one of the best meals i have ever eaten.
reviews.title: Ten out of Ten

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was the weather which was terrible but sitting in the cosy lounge in front of the fire with a pot of fresh coffee and home made cookies made up for it.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am already planning my return visit to Hipping Hall hopefully when the sun shines but i can imagine it would be fantastic for a pre christmas treat
reviews.title: fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfection - We stayed at Hipping Hall on Mothering Sunday (March 2nd 2008), and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: food to die for

likes.disliked: — tea and coffe in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hipping Hall for a birthday treat. The room in the cottage was extremely noisy and we could hear other guests talking but the room itself was nice, save for a few cracked tiles and a mouldy patch on the bathroom ceiling.
reviews.title: Fabulous Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part of the stay by far was an amazing evening meal. We started with drinks and canapes in the lounge, however felt that we were a liitle bit rushed through to the dining room. It is not a matter of the staff being ready for us to dine but when we are ready!!!
reviews.title: Great!

likes.disliked: — No tea and coffee in rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That said, the food was incredible and although we couldn't describe our stay as the best ever, the over rehearsed service of some of the staff wouldn't stop us returning.
reviews.title: Top class hotel, food & service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A really great small hotel with excellent service and great food, and a very relaxed and welcoming atmosphere. The hotel is conveniently located between the Yorkshire Dales and the Lake District, making it possible to explore both easily.
reviews.title: Our favourite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are airy, nice and quiet, though surprisingly lacking tea/coffee facilities. The restaurant offers a good selection of dishes with special requests catered for without any problems. The service was attentive and friendly.
reviews.title: A Country House Gem

description: Hipping Hall is a modern country restaurant with 3 AA Rosette dining and luxuriously appointed bedrooms.Sitting between the beautiful English Lake District and the rugged Yorkshire Dales, Hipping Hall is the perfect venue to explore the very best of what the North-West has to offer.
